quote: How's it going, Jake?
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Fine.  I've deleted about half the    Cardassian files from the computer.     I can't believe how many subroutines    it took just to run this ore    processor.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Well, it used to be a pretty large    operation.  When the Cardassians    were in charge, I understand they    were processing twenty thousand tons    a day.       It must've been hell in here... I've    heard stories that the temperature    used to reach fifty-five degrees    Celsius.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: How could the Bajoran workers survive    that?
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: A lot of them didn't.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: As soon as you've deleted all those    files, I'll show you how to download    the new operating system.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: You really think we can convert this    place into a deuterium refinery?
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Absolutely.  It'll take us three,    maybe four weeks at the most.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: I hope you're planning on eating    sometime during those four weeks.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Commander... I guess I lost track of    the time.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: We're almost finished, Dad.       Chief, I'm having a problem deleting    one of these files.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Did you try reformatting the data    cluster?
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Yeah, but the file's still here...
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Let me see...       Well, that's odd.  The file has no    name... no indication of what it    is... I better set this aside for    now.  I can transfer it to the central    database in Ops and analyze it in    the morning.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Wait a minute...
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Unauthorized computer entry detected    in Ore Processing Unit Five.  Enter    access code.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Incorrect code.  You have five seconds    to enter correct access code.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Or what?
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: I don't know.  But I'm going to shut    this thing down.
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: Warning...
scene: 1    INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - ORE PROCESSING UNIT

quote: ... worker revolt in progress in Ore    Processing Unit Five... Security    countermeasures initiated.
What the hell... ?
Bajoran workers... your attention    please.
Your attempt to seize control of    this facility is going to fail.  You    are valuable workers and we wish you    no harm.
However if you do not return control    of this unit to your Cardassian    supervisors, we will be forced to    take action.  Consider your options
The computer's engaged the magnetic    seal.  I can't override it.
Ops to Sisko.
Go ahead.
Commander, what's going on down there?     We just got a recorded message from    Gul Dukat regarding some worker revolt    in the ore processing facility.
We saw the same message.  It seems    we've tripped some kind of automated    security program left by the    Cardassians.  We're locked in.
We'll beam you out of there.
Enter access code.
What?

If this security program thinks    there's been some kind of worker    revolt... then it must also think    the station is still under Cardassian    rule... so it's probably waiting for    us to enter some kind of emergency    code.
One that the Cardassians never    bothered to tell us when they left.
Commander, we're not going to be    able to transport you out of there    just yet.
Understood.
Odo to Ops.
This is Kira.
My Cardassian access codes are still    valid.  I'm attempting to override    the security program... but it's    going to take some time.
I'm not sure my clearance level is    high enough.
Keep at it.  We'll try to do the    same thing from up here.
Acknowledged.
Odo, do you mind telling me what    this is all about?  That message    from Dukat is making my customers    nervous... and when they're nervous    they're not --
Not now, Quark.  I'm busy.
Well... is there anything I can do    to help?
Not unless you have a level nine    Cardassian security clearance.
Let's see... I think I have everything    from levels one through seven.
I only have levels one through six.
Well if you'd like level seven, I'm    sure we could come to some kind of    an arrangement.
Leave me alone, Quark.
Oh, no.  Something very wrong's going    on... and this is the safest place    on the whole station.  So I'll just    stay right here.
Whatever you want, Quark... but do    it quietly.
Any luck?
Nothing.  It's probably magnetically    sealed like the door.  We'd need a    phaser to blast it open.
There's just no way I can disable    the program from here.
Bajoran workers.  Your time is running    out.  But it's not too late... you    can still surrender and save your    lives.
Computer.  This is... the leader of    the Bajoran workers.  We surrender.

I'm glad to see that you've come to    your senses.  Stay where you are.     When Cardassian security arrives,    they will place you into custody --    but you will not be harmed.  You    have my word.
For whatever that's worth.
Now what?
It sounds like the program is going    to wait for "Cardassian Security" to    enter the all-clear protocol.  That'll    give us a few minutes, anyway...
What's in here?
Nothing at the moment.  Processed    uridium used to flow down that pipe    to a secondary refining facility on    level thirty-three where it was    purified.
It's not locked.
That's because that pipe would've    been filled with molten uridium...    there was no need for any security    measures.
It's too narrow for anyone to try    and escape through.
I can get in there.
If he crawls up this pipe into the    machine... is there some way he can    get to the ore chute and open...    (pointing to overhead     hatch)   ... that hatch from the inside?

Bajoran workers.  You have not    surrendered to Cardassian security.     If you do not do so in the next four    minutes, I will be forced to release    neurocine gas into the ore processing    facility.
I can do it.
Jake... can you hear me?
Loud and clear.  But I can't see a    thing...
There should be a large circular    opening to your right.
Okay... let me see if I can find    it...
Ow!
Are you all right?
Yeah... I just banged my head on    something.
Wait a minute... there's a junction    here... it feels like it goes off in    two directions... which way do I go?
Follow this sound, Jake.
Do it again, Dad.
Got it.  I'm in the chute.

You have  access port on one of the ?  one minute left to give   walls... yourselves up to your Cardassian overseers and    JAKE'S COM VOICE save your lives. Even    O'BRIEN if you were to escape this  Open the port and feel  station -- and believe me,  around until you find a  such an event is    handle... If so, then   again. perhaps you have been  deluded by a few  malcontents.

Ask yourselves why you are   I'm trying... doing this.  What do you  really hope to accomplish?    SISKO Do you really think you   Relax.  Don't tense up... can harm Cardassia by    Take a deep breath and try  your actions?  If so, then   again. perhaps you have been  deluded by a few  malcontents.
Believe me, they're the   I got it!  I got it!  I'm  ones who deserve to be    pulling it down! punished, not you.  I'm  sure if you think about  it... you would agree.
I'm sorry, but your time has run    out.  I was hoping you would be    reasonable... Rest assured that your    deaths will serve as an example to    prevent similar incidents in the    future.
Maybe if we bypass the primary command    pathway and cross-connect the backup    with the ODN...
Warning.  Workers have escaped from    Ore Processing Unit Five.  Initiating    stationwide counterinsurgency    program.
Now what... ?
Attention Bajoran workers... I will    not allow this rebellion to succeed.     If you do not surrender immediately...    I will kill every Bajoran on this    station.
Wait a second... I found something.
What is it?
I don't know... some kind of room.
It sure is dirty.
Doesn't smell too good either.
Looks like some kind of... loading    bay.
You're right... this is where the    uridium ore was separated from the    rock.  Then it would be dumped down    that chute to the processing facility.
Locked.
Chief, is there another way out of    here?
Just back down the chute, and we    know where that leads.
Sisko to Ops.       Sisko to Security.       Try yours.
O'Brien to Ops.
This is Jake Sisko to anyone who can    hear me.
There must be something interfering    with the signal.
What do we do now?
It's no good.  We're completely cut    off from the rest of the station.
It looks like there's some kind of    general dampening field in place...    it must be disrupting communications.
All right... let's try a less subtle    approach.
Cardassians don't miss a trick, do    they?
The ironic thing is that the field    is probably there to protect Ops    from hoards of rebelling Bajorans.
We have to find a way to disable    that security program or a lot of    innocent people are going to be    killed.
If we can regain control of the main    computer, we may be able to wipe the    security program from its memory.
Now if I can reroute the APT relay    through the secondary buffer, I might    get an independent terminal working...
You know... I've been here almost    three years now... and I was finally    starting to think of this place as    home.
Your "home" was built by Cardassians,    Julian... don't ever forget that.
Not much danger of that, is there?
What do you mean we're trapped?
I mean...
... we're trapped.  I wouldn't be    surprised if the entire station is    locked down.
But you're a Shape-shifter.       Excuse me -- a changeling.  So change    into something and get us out of    here.
This forcefield isn't just protecting    the door... it goes through the    bulkheads, the deck, the ceiling...    there's nowhere for me to go.
And stay away from my computer.
You're telling me I'm stuck here    with you?
No, I'm stuck here with you.  Believe    me, a far worse fate.
Again... again... again... Okay.     Hold on.
Anything?
Not even a dent...
There has to be something else we    can do.       What about all this ore?
As I understand it, uridium is highly    unstable.
True, but in it's raw form, you'd    need a strong electrical charge to    detonate it.
Can we use this?
If I had some tools, I might be able    to get in there and yank out some    electrical cable.
How's it coming?
Almost done.
Jadzia!
Get me a medkit.
I was reaching toward the main ODN    conduit... a small forcefield flashed    on... it caught my hands...
Easy, Jadzia... I have to look at    them.       Second-degree burns... but I don't    think there's any neural damage...
This should relieve the pain.
Warning, security in the Operations    Center has been compromised.     Initiating counterinsurgency program    level two.

Attention Bajoran Workers.  Your    failure to surrender is forcing me    to take stronger measures... in five    minutes, we will begin pumping    neurocine gas into the Habitat Ring.     Think of your families as you consider    your course of action.  All Cardassian    personnel should evacuate the area    immediately.
The Habitat Ring... there must be    hundreds of people trapped in their    quarters out there.
I believe that's the point, Major.
Computer, access code Garak one-three-   five-nine.
Identity confirmed.
Ironic isn't it?  That the only place    in the galaxy that still recognizes    my access code is a Bajoran space    station.
If you can get past the forcefields,    then you've got to get out to the    Habitat Ring and start evacuating    those people before --

I'd like nothing better than to help    my loyal customers, but it's not    that simple.  My access code allows    me to move around the station...    unfortunately, as you've just seen,    the forcefields reappear as soon as    I pass through a doorway.
Have you tried to use your code to    shut down the security program?
Several times.  But for some reason    that I can't begin to fathom, Gul    Dukat chose not to trust me with his    top level security codes during the    occupation.
Garak, do you have any idea how we    can stop the neurocine gas?
The only way to do that is to destroy    the life support system.
That's insane.  What are you trying    to do Garak?  Get us all killed?
No, wait a minute.  He's right.  The    neurocine gas is released through    the life support system.  Destroy    it... and we save everyone in the    Habitat Ring.
For twelve hours.  And then everyone    on the station will suffocate when    the oxygen runs out.
That gives us twelve hours to find a    way to regain control of the station.
Believe me, Major, it's the only way    to save those people.       I believe life support is controlled    from over there.
Get down.
Warning.  Counterinsurgency program    level two has been interrupted.     Initiating counterinsurgency program    level three.
My fellow Cardassians... I regret to    inform you that Bajoran workers have    gained control of this station.
In all likelihood, I am dead or    otherwise incapacitated...
But rest assured, this station will    not be allowed to remain in Bajoran    hands...
However it is my duty to inform you    that if you do not regain control    within two hours, the station will    be destroyed.
Self-destruct sequence initiated.
Come on... come on!
Give me that before you hurt yourself.       I checked the entire security    complex... there's no way out.
I should've listened to my father.     He always warned me this would happen.
What?  That you'd spend your final    hours in jail?  I could've told you    that.

No.  He warned me never to leave    home... that there were plenty of    business opportunities right outside    my door.  But no, I had to follow    the seventy-fifth Rule of Acquisition:    "Home is where the heart is... but    the stars are made of latinum."       A lifetime of plotting and scheming,    wheeling and dealing -- and what has    it got me?  One measly little bar.     My uncle Frin owns thirty... and my    cousin Gaila...
I know... he owns a moon.
I told you that?
Many times.
It's a small moon, but it's enough    to live on.
Come on, Quark... you've done all    right for yourself.
What would you know about it?
Quark... I've met a lot of Ferengis    in my time... and the truth is...    although some of them may have been    more wealthy... I've never met one    more devious.
Really?
Would I lie?
I guess not.       Thank you, Odo.  That means a lot to    me.  Now can I have the phaser back?
No.
How do they feel?
A little better...
Good.  I wish I could do more, but I    won't be able to repair the tissue    damage until we can get you to the    Infirmary.
Any luck?

Plenty, Major.  Unfortunately, all    of it bad.  My personal code will    activate any terminal on the station,    however, that's the extent of my    access.  All I can do is... look    around.  I can tell you exactly what's    going on, but I can't do anything    about it.
As far as I can tell, the only person    who can disable the security program    is Gul Dukat.
Maybe there's a way to fool the    computer into thinking you are Gul    Dukat.  You could try rewriting your    code to match his.
Even if I could it wouldn't do any    good.
If I were to input his code, the    computer would scan my DNA pattern    to determine if I really were Dukat.
But what if we disconnected the    sensors in Ops... so that the computer    couldn't scan you?
What a creative idea.       Tell me, do you eat breakfast,    Lieutenant?
Excuse me?
My lunch calendar is full, but I am    looking for someone to join me at    breakfast.  I'm sure the Doctor will    tell you it's the most important    meal of the day.
This is no time to plan your social    calendar.  Can you rewrite your access    code or not?
It's certainly worth a try.
The question is, can we disable the    sensors...       Without getting anyone else hurt.
We'll have to take that chance.

We could switch the sensor input    from the primary scanners to the    backup scanners.  The computer    shouldn't see that as a threat but    it'll blind the system for a few    seconds during the changeover.
If this works, all I'll need is a    few seconds.
Major, I'm going to need a hand.
Doctor, what exactly is it about    this situation that's making you    smile?
You, Garak.  I wonder how many other    tailors can rewrite Cardassian    security protocols?
I wouldn't even venture a guess.     But that reminds me... those pants    you wanted altered are ready to be    picked up.
Well... this is a problem.
What's wrong?
I always suspected that Gul Dukat    was a little paranoid... he left    quite a large number of interrogative    subroutines imbedded in his access    code.
Meaning what?
Meaning the computer is continually    trying to make me prove I am who I    say I am.
Lieutenant, how long until you'll be    able to disable those sensors?
Another ten minutes at least.
We may not have that much time... in    fact, I'm sure we don't.
Warning.  Unauthorized use of command    code.  Initiating counterinsurgency    program level four.
On three... One, two, three.
You did it.
Okay... I see a power cable.  Now we    just have to pack the uridium around    the door.
Jake, what time's our racquetball    game tomorrow?
Fourteen hundred hours.
Looks like neither one of us will    get much sleep before then... Tell    you what... I'll spot you five points.
If you really want a challenge, you    should play Chief O'Brien.  He's got    a wicked backhand.
So I hear...       But I'm told he's a little weak in    the corners.
Let me guess... You've been talking    to Julian.
He may have said something.

Let me put it this way, Commander...    with Keiko down on Bajor, I've had a    lot of time to work on my game.       Of course, by the time we're through    here, I don't know how my shoulder's    going to feel.
Come on, Chief.  I haven't even beaten    you yet, and you're already making    excuses.
Tell you what, Commander, if we get    out of this... I'll spot you five    points.
You're on.
My phaser's on the Ops table.  Can    anyone get to it?
The answer, Major, is no.
Well, we can't just sit here.
I respectfully disagree, Major.     Sitting here is about all we can do.
Let me guess... someone tried to    duplicate my access code.
Dukat... what the hell are you doing    here?

A short time ago, I had the strangest    experience... there I was, patrolling    the demilitarized zone, when I    received a distress signal -- from    me.  Or at least a recording of me.     It seems that the Bajoran workers    were rioting on Terok Nor.  I must    admit, it did pique my curiosity.
I see the auto-destruct program has    begun.  You are in trouble.       Where's Commander Sisko?  I trust he    wasn't vaporized while asking for    one of those raktajinos he's so fond    of.
No... the last we heard, he was    trapped in the ore processing unit.
Hmm.  I wish him well.
Can you help us, or not?
Oh, most certainly.  All I have to    do is enter my command code and shut    the program.
Then do it!
All in good time, Major.  But first,    there are a few things we should    discuss.       Red leaf tea, please.
Doctor...
What is it you want, Dukat?
You'll find I don't respond well to    that tone of voice, Major.
Ah, Garak... groveling in a corner.     That alone makes the trip worthwhile.
Garak!
Easy, Doctor... it would seem that    the computer is only targeting non-   Cardassians after all.
If you'd been on the station when I    designed this program I would have    made an exception in your case.
You've always been shortsighted...    it's held you back over the years.       As I recall, your father had the    same flaw.
My father's only flaw was in trusting    you.
Funny... at his trial, your father    said his biggest flaw was that his    ambition outweighed his patriotism.
Maybe you two should settle this    another time!
You're right, Major.       And believe me, Garak, that time is    coming.
Major, why don't you join me in the    Commander's office?  So we can talk...    in private.
Oh.  I forgot -- the replicator.     Well, I suppose it's the least I can    do.
You can all rise now.  You're safe...    for the moment.

Major, I know time is of the essence    so I'll be brief.  I think it's time    to re-establish a permanent Cardassian    presence on this station... nothing    too elaborate... a garrison should    suffice.  I can deploy troops from    my ship immediately.  In return,    I'll solve your current dilemma.
You know I'm not going to agree to    that.
I'm not sure you have much of a    choice.
Dukat, you know as well as I do that    neither Bajor nor the Federation    will honor an agreement negotiated    under a death threat.
I don't expect them to be happy about    it, but once my troops are in place,    I think you'll find it very difficult    to get them to leave.
All right, let me put it another    way... I would destroy this station    before I'd give it back to the    Cardassians.
I don't doubt it.  But would you    condemn the two thousand people aboard    this station to death, just because    you don't like us?

No need to decide just yet... we    still have some time left... thirty    minutes, in fact.  Why don't I return    to my ship and let you... think it    over.  I'll return in say... twenty-   five minutes.       This is Dukat.  One to transport.     Energize.
Energize.
Dukat... if you're seeing this    recording, it means you tried to    abandon your post while the station's    self-destruct sequence was engaged.     That will not be permitted.
This is outrageous.

You have lost control of Terok Nor,    disgracing yourself and Cardassia.     Your attempt to escape is no doubt a    final act of cowardice.  All fail-   safes have been eliminated.  Your    personal access codes have been    rescinded.  The destruct sequence    can no longer be halted.  All you    can do now is contemplate the depth    of your disgrace.       And try to die like a Cardassian.
Computer, abort the self-destruct    sequence.  This is a priority one    override.  Clearance level nine.     Authorization:  Dukat five-one-one-   six green.
Request denied.  All authorization    codes are void.  Time to self-   destruct: twenty-five minutes.
Your own computer program turned    against you.  I always said your    shortsightedness would be your    downfall.
I don't see you coming up with any    ideas, tailor.
Look, if you're finished with the    insults, we can use some help here.       What can you tell us about the self-   destruct sequence?

It's very simple.  When the countdown    is complete, the computer will order    the main fusion reactor to disengage    the reaction stabilizers... causing    it to overload... and destroy the    station.
What about the reactor... is there    some way to shut it down?
It may be possible to manually    disengage the laser fusion    inititator... but we would need to    be in the reactor room.
Not necessarily... we can disengage    the initiator from one of the control    junctions on Level Thirty-four.
But now that the computer's wiped    out the access codes, not even a    Cardassian can get out of this room.
Then maybe we should concentrate on    trying to eliminate the forcefield    protecting the door.

We don't have time to eliminate every    forcefield between here and Level    Thirty-four.       What we need to do is find a way to    deactivate all the forcefields on    the station at the same time.
That oughta do it.  If we use much    more we run the risk of bringing    this whole room down around our heads.
All right, we'd better take cover.
Ready when you are, Chief.
Would you like the honors, Commander?
Keep your heads down.
It worked.
I set up this program, and I assure    you Major, I'll find a way to defeat    it.  There's no dilemma that can't    be solved by a disciplined, Cardassian    mind.
It's not going to work, you know.
What are you babbling about now?
I'm talking about Major Kira...
What about her?
She's much too busy trying to save    this station to be impressed by your    incessant posturing.  And even if    she weren't, she has much better    taste than to be attracted to you.
And you, a married man...
I should've had you executed years    ago.
You tried, remember?
Garak, this isn't helping.
Wait a minute...
What about the power supply grid?     If we can overload the grid, we might    be able to cause a power surge and    short out the forcefields.
It might even eliminate the dampening    field that's been keeping us from    using our communicators.
Tell me, Major... the Cardassian    neutralization emitters that were    under here... I assume you deactivated    them when you took over the station?
That's right.  We prefer our    containment fields to be non-lethal.
But are the emitters still in place?
As far as I know.
Excellent.  That means they weren't    affected by the counterinsurgency    program.  We still have control over    them.
Then if we bring them back on line,    we can use the emitters to overload    the power grid.
Exactly.
You think that'll be enough to short    out the forcefields?
Unfortunately, we'll also lose the    transporters and turbolifts.  But    they aren't doing us much good right    now anyway...
All right... let's give it a try.
Anything?
I only got a couple hundred meters    before I was stopped by a forcefield.     How about you?
We didn't even get that far.
Dammit... there must be some way to    get to Ops...

Level Twenty-nine Section D.  What's    your status in Ops?

Warning, main fusion reactors will    overload in six minutes.

Do you?

It's because they knew you were an    honorable man... the kind of person    who'd do the right thing regardless    of the circumstances... and now your    integrity is going to get us both    killed.  I hope you're happy.
Warning, main fusion reactors will    overload in five minutes.

There might be a way.
